page.title: 19Parks
page.content: The four parks in our block include Oakhill Park Howarth Park King Georges Playing Fields Baxenden Park. Baxenden Park is only a very small recently built park.And King Georges is used mainly for it's playing fields. Howarth P has it's own art gallery which contains the biggest collection of Tiffany Glass in England.The rest of the grounds is mainly grass bushes and trees.The Art Gallery was opened in 1909.Oakhill Park was opened by Reginald Gervais Hargreaves Esq:On whit-Monday 22nd May 1893.Thomas Whittaker Mayor.There is a mansion in the park which is now derilict.It was once lived in and the Park was it's gardens.Behind the mansion there is a fountain which was presented by W M Smith JP.CC.An Alderman of this Borough July 1893.There is a monument at the top of the park.
